channel.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
channel.description:
Hello, I've been keeping an eye on my whonix gateway logs lately and noticed two things. The first is this:
https://tor.stackexchange.com/questions/14928/time-has-been-changed-message
I am also seeing "Time has been changed" spamming my logs. It happens a dozen times a day for about 20 minutes each time. Should I do something about this? What does it mean?
The second thing is:
> Jul 05 16:51:21 host Tor[1217]: We tried for 15 seconds to connect to '[scrubbed]' using exit $786926E8C497A6924ED69E23D48B13E92D1E07EE~memcpy at 163.172.67.180. Retrying on a new circuit. > Jul 05 16:51:36 host Tor[1217]: We tried for 15 seconds to connect to '[scrubbed]' using exit $0818DAE0E2DDF795AEDEAC60B15E71901084F281~edwardsnowden1 at 109.163.234.8. Retrying on a new circuit. > Jul 05 16:51:36 host Tor[1217]: Tried for 130 seconds to get a connection to [scrubbed]:443. Giving up.
Several dozens of lines like that. Also occures 20+ times a day. Should I be concerned or do anything about it?
I've made no modifications to the gateway or VM settings. I'm using it with Virtualbox in a linux distro. The gateway is completely up to date.
> Distributor ID: Whonix > Description: Whonix GNU/Linux 8.8 (jessie) > Release: 8.8 > Codename: jessie
> Linux host 3.16.0-4-686-pae #1 SMP Debian 3.16.43-2+deb8u2 (2017-06-26) i686 GNU/Linux

item.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
item.dc:creator: captain11
item.description:
Nope, I don’t freeze or hibernate at all. I boot the gateway and the time messages just happen randomly.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
item.dc:creator: catch22
item.description:
Time has changed...

Small thing but gotta ask, do you freeze or hibernate? Perhaps it unsyncs the clock hence barrage of going back time.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
item.dc:creator: captain11
item.description:
@Patrick, I didn’t think I was compromised. Not at all. I thought maybe there was a bug in my gateway.

Thank you for your replies. So everything is fine overall? I’ll ignore both kinds of activity in my logs.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
item.dc:creator: Hexagon
item.description:
captain11:

I am also seeing “Time has been changed” spamming my logs. It happens a dozen times a day for about 20 minutes each time. Should I do something about this? What does it mean?

I’m not sure but I guess this could be caused by the gradual time adjustment by sdwdate.

Edit: just found this: https://phabricator.whonix.org/T691

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix Gateway syslogs question
item.dc:creator: captain11
item.description:
Hello, I’ve been keeping an eye on my whonix gateway logs lately and noticed two things. The first is this:

tor.stackexchange.com

"Time has been changed" message?

configuration, error, whonix, log
asked by user17759 on 03:03PM - 05 Jun 17

I am also seeing “Time has been changed” spamming my logs. It happens a dozen times a day for about 20 minutes each time. Should I do something about this? What does it mean?

The second thing is:

Jul 05 16:51:21 host Tor[1217]: We tried for 15 seconds to connect to ‘[scrubbed]’ using exit $786926E8C497A6924ED69E23D48B13E92D1E07EE~memcpy at 163.172.67.180. Retrying on a new circuit.
Jul 05 16:51:36 host Tor[1217]: We tried for 15 seconds to connect to ‘[scrubbed]’ using exit $0818DAE0E2DDF795AEDEAC60B15E71901084F281~edwardsnowden1 at 109.163.234.8. Retrying on a new circuit.
Jul 05 16:51:36 host Tor[1217]: Tried for 130 seconds to get a connection to [scrubbed]:443. Giving up.

Several dozens of lines like that. Also occures 20+ times a day. Should I be concerned or do anything about it?

I’ve made no modifications to the gateway or VM settings. I’m using it with Virtualbox in a linux distro. The gateway is completely up to date.

Distributor ID: Whonix
Description: Whonix GNU/Linux 8.8 (jessie)
Release: 8.8
Codename: jessie

Linux host 3.16.0-4-686-pae #1 SMP Debian 3.16.43-2+deb8u2 (2017-06-26) i686 GNU/Linux

Read full topic
